headline: Dave Ramsey Caller Says Her Daughter Should Be Paid $1,000 For A Job Interview. 'This Is Entitlement 101, Guaranteeing She Doesn't Get The Job'
summary: A recent episode of “The Ramsey Show” sparked a strong reaction when a caller from Idaho asked if it was appropriate for her daughter to request reimbursement from a potential employer for a job interview trip that would cost about $1,000. Her daughter, who just graduated college, was preparing to travel for the final round of interviews after passing three earlier stages. headline: How Google Is Walking the AI Tightrope
summary: Liz Reid,  the Google search boss, has a tough job.  At the same time, Google’s lawyers are working to convince federal judges determining the company’s fate that, in fact, AI poses a huge threat to its monopoly businesses.  “So both Google can grow very successfully, and other people can grow successfully.”

headline: Does Cisco’s AI-Optimized Silicon One Chip Reshape the Bull Case for Cisco Systems (CSCO)?
summary: Cisco Systems recently launched its Silicon One P200 chip and 8223 routing system, engineered to connect large-scale AI data centers with improved power efficiency and scalability, and already shipping to major customers like Microsoft and Alibaba. This innovation consolidates data routing capabilities within a single chip, using 65% less power than previous solutions and underscoring Cisco's competitive response to the heightened demand for advanced AI infrastructure. We'll examine how...
